# Pointing nouns

## Introduction

Pointing nouns are the Arabic equivalents of words like "this", "that", "these", "those". We call them pointing nouns because a person saying "this", for example, could be pointing to an object near him.

The pointing nouns in Arabic are:

|Person|Pointing noun (u-state)|Pointing noun (a-state and i-state)|
|:--|:--|:--|
|this~masc.~       |[هَـٰذَا]{.ar}   [hApA]{.trn}     | same |
|this~fem.~        |[هَـٰذِهِ]{.ar}   [hApihi]{.trn}   | same |
|these~dual\ masc.~|[هَـٰذَانِ]{.ar}  [hApAni]{.trn}   |[هَـٰذَيْنِ]{.ar}  [hApayni]{.trn}   |
|these~dual\ fem.~ |[هَاتَانِ]{.ar}  [hAtAni]{.trn}   |[هَاتَيْنِ]{.ar}  [hAtayni]{.trn}   |
|these~pl.~        |[هَـٰؤُلَاءِ]{.ar} [hAEulAEi]{.trn} | same  |
|that~masc.~       |[ذَ ٰلِكَ]{.ar}   [pAlika]{.trn}   | same  |
|that~fem.~        |[تِلْكَ]{.ar}    [tilka]{.trn}    | same  |
|those~dual\ masc.~|[ذَ ٰنِكَ]{.ar}   [pAnika]{.trn}   |[ذَيْنِكَ]{.ar}   [paynika]{.trn}   |
|those~dual\ fem.~ |[تَانِكَ]{.ar}   [tAnika]{.trn}   |[تَيْنِكَ]{.ar}   [taynika]{.trn}   |
|those~pl.~        |[أُولَـٰئِكَ]{.ar} [EulAEika]{.trn} | same |
